page.title: 04ARCHITECTURAL STYLE
page.content: Many large farm houses some lived in by the farmer.Others sold and now private houses or tenanted by business people.Also small farm houses and cottages, some tied.A small estate of council houses and a few bungalows, built by the council for the elderly. Mixture of houses built between the sixteenth and twentieth century.Many restored since 1945.Several houses awaiting planning permission for special repairs and extentions.North of the area on the B1053 and South East on the B1057 a number of small houses and cottages have been built. Different textures have been used to build all the houses in this area,from brick,plaster,weatherboard to flint. Roofs are mainly thatched, tiled, or slated.Decoration is pargetting in local tradition.Through rising labour costs, people do their own repairs.
